page.title: 12 STAPLETON MEAD FARM
page.content:
Our farm is called{Stapleton Mead {Farm. We came here in 1971.We have 55 cows and ten calves.The cows are 50 Friesians and five Ayrshires.There are 55 milking cows but no dry cows at the moment. We farm 112 acres (44.5 hectares) which is divided into 14 fields.The biggest is 13 acres and the smallest is 2\ acres.78 cows can fit into the cubicles.With no delays it takes one week to make silage,but a month to make 2,000 bales.We have two tractors and other machinery like a mower, wuffler,trailers and a forage harvester.
Daniel Smith.
